p: The major contribution to the current distribution of L. guanicoe was given by the annual range of temperature (28.2%, AUC = 0.84), whereas L.g. cacsilensis was dominated by precipitation seasonality (66.7%, AUC = 0.95), the mixed population by annual precipitation (36.7%, AUC = 0.93), and the southernmost L.g. guanicoe was mostly driven by annual mean temperature (35.8%, AUC = 0.91). Detailed Jackknifeâ€™s analysis can be seen in supplemental information, Fig. S2.
